alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 04 at 5:24AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow will affect Kennebec...Knox...Waldo... Oxford...central Androscoggin...southeastern Somerset...Lincoln... northern Sagadahoc...Franklin and Coos Counties... At 523 AM EST...An area of heavy snow was along a line extending from Stratford to 18 miles southeast of Bremen...and moving northeast AT 40 MPH. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Augusta, Waterville, Berlin, Bath, Farmington, Rockland, Belfast, Fairfield, Gardiner, Camden, Bethel, Colebrook, Damariscotta, Lincolnville, Skowhegan, Thorndike, Oakland, Rangeley and Searsport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 37 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 145. This also includes... Umbagog Lake State Park, First Connecticut Lake, Kilkenny Ridge Trail, Old Speck Mountain, and Saddleback Mountain. Burnt Island, Metinic Island, Friendship Long Island, Cranberry Island, and Otter Island. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow. * Sudden and brief snowfall rates greater than 2 inches per hour are possible in this area of heavy snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
